dt.t: One of the boys {wi}mooned{/wi} the crowd.

to expose one's naked buttocks to
to spend time in idle reverie : behave abstractedly

dt: {bc}the earth's natural satellite {dx_def}see {dxt|satellite||1a}{/dx_def} that shines by the sun's reflected light, revolves about the earth from west to east in about 29¹/₂ days with reference to the sun or about 27¹/₃ days with reference to the stars, and has a diameter of 2160 miles (3475 {d_link|kilometers|kilometer}), a mean distance from the earth of about 238,900 miles (384,400 kilometers), and a mass about one eightieth that of the earth
{bc}one complete moon cycle consisting of four phases {dx_def}see {dxt|phase:1||1}{/dx_def}
{bc}an indefinite usually extended period of time

dt.t: keep out of the {wi}moon{/wi} or it may turn your head

dt: {bc}something that resembles a moon: such as
{bc}a highly translucent {dx_def}see {dxt|translucent||1}{/dx_def} spot on old porcelain

et: Middle English {it}mone{/it}, from Old English {it}mōna{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}māno{/it} moon, Latin {it}mensis{/it} month, Greek {it}mēn{/it} month, {it}mēnē{/it} moon
shortdef: the earth's natural satellite that shines by the sun's reflected light, revolves about the earth from west to east in about 291/2 days with reference to the sun or about 271/3 days with reference to the stars, and has a diameter of 2160 miles (3475 kilometers), a mean distance from the earth of about 238,900 miles (384,400 kilometers), and a mass about one eightieth that of the earth —usually used with the
one complete moon cycle consisting of four phases
satellite; specifically : a natural satellite of a planet

dt.t: I visited my old school yesterday for the first time in {it}many moons{/it}.
But that was all {it}many moons{/it} ago.

dt: {bc}a {d_link|full moon|full moon} that coincides with a full {d_link|lunar eclipse|lunar eclipse} and that has an unusually reddish appearance
The red color of a blood moon is caused by the diffusion of the sun's light into the shadow cast by the Earth.

dt.t: And when it [the full moon] is eclipsed by the shadow of the Earth, it is called a {wi}blood moon{/wi} as it turns a crimson color.
Through the little windows over the deep double kitchen sink, I saw a big sliver of {wi}blood moon{/wi} sinking below the distant mountains.

dt: {bc}a full lunar eclipse during which a blood moon occurs

dt.t: A {wi}blood moon{/wi} is the unscientific name for a total lunar eclipse, which is when Earth passes in between the sun and the moon, casting a shadow over the moon as sunlight is blocked.

shortdef: a full moon that coincides with a full lunar eclipse and that has an unusually reddish appearance; also : a full lunar eclipse during which a blood moon occurs

dt: usually used in the phrase {it}once in a blue moon{/it}

dt.t: such people happen along only once in a {it}blue moon{/it}

dt: {bc}a second full moon in a calendar month

shortdef: a very long period of time —usually used in the phrase once in a blue moon
a second full moon in a calendar month

dt: {bc}the moon with its whole apparent disk illuminated

shortdef: the moon with its whole apparent disk illuminated

dt: {bc}the moon when half its disk appears illuminated

shortdef: the moon when half its disk appears illuminated

dt: {bc}the full moon nearest the time of the September equinox

shortdef: the full moon nearest the time of the September equinox

dt: {bc}the moon's phase when it is in conjunction with the sun so that its dark side is toward the earth
{bc}the thin crescent moon seen shortly after sunset for a few days after the actual occurrence of the new moon phase
{bc}the beginning of each Jewish month marked by a special liturgy

shortdef: the moon's phase when it is in conjunction with the sun so that its dark side is toward the earth; also : the thin crescent moon seen shortly after sunset for a few days after the actual occurrence of the new moon phase
the beginning of each Jewish month marked by a special liturgy

dt: {bc}to spend too much time thinking about or looking at (someone or something that one admires or wants very much)
